titleStmt.title: Good and joyful news for England: or, The prophecy of the renowned Michael Nostradamus that Charles the II. of Great Britain, France and Ireland King, Defender of the faith, &c. shall have a son of his own body lawfully begotten, that shall succeed him in the imperial throne of Great Britain, and all other his dominions; and reign long after his father, most fortunately and well beloved. As it was taken out of the translations of Dr. Theo. Garencieres, M.D. Col. Lond. Printed 1672. in fol. With observations concerning the present blazing-comet. By J.B. Philalelos, a true and faithful Protestant, of the first and best rate and rank.
titleStmt.author: J. B., Philalelos.

titleStmt.title: Good and joyful news for England: or, The prophecy of the renowned Michael Nostradamus that Charles the II. of Great Britain, France and Ireland King, Defender of the faith, &c. shall have a son of his own body lawfully begotten, that shall succeed him in the imperial throne of Great Britain, and all other his dominions; and reign long after his father, most fortunately and well beloved. As it was taken out of the translations of Dr. Theo. Garencieres, M.D. Col. Lond. Printed 1672. in fol. With observations concerning the present blazing-comet. By J.B. Philalelos, a true and faithful Protestant, of the first and best rate and rank.
titleStmt.author: J. B., Philalelos.
Garencières, Theophilus, 1610-1680.
Ness, Christopher, 1621-1705.
Nostradamus, 1503-1566.

notesStmt.note: A commentary, by J. B. Philalelos, on part of Nostradamus's 'Prophéties', the English translation of which was published in 1672 under the title 'The true prophecies or prognostications of Michael Nostradamus'.
Includes: 'A second sheet, further blazoning upon the blazing-star', signed at end: C.N., i.e. Christopher Ness, and with a colophon which reads: "Published by L. Curtiss, on Ludgate-hill, 1681".
Bodleian Library copy lacks all after p. 8.
